titleStmt.title: Partial Manuscripts Schema, constrained for usage in XForms
titleStmt.author: Maximilian de Molière
Nathan Gibson
Maximilian de Molière

publicationStmt.authority: Institut für den Nahen und Mittleren Osten
publicationStmt.publisher: ERC-funded project: MAJLIS. The Transformation of Jewish Literature in Arabic in the Islamicate World

availability.licence: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

revisionDesc.change: Created schema on basis of Arabic Manuscripts Schema created by Pietro Liuzzo

div.head: Information on this customization
div.p: Schema for MAJLIS Project. This part of the schema is used for entering descriptions of the manuscript support using XForms.
Built on the Beta maṣāḥǝft Guidelines contain examples and details of that customization.
Added Rules from the consolidated schema of FIRHIST
Constrained this schema for generating forms.

moduleRef.except: list abbr add biblScope binaryObject ellipsis emph expan foreign gap graphic imprint item measureGrp note noteGrp orig teiCorpus textLang addrLine address analytic author bibl biblStruct cb choice cit citedRange corr date del desc distinct divGen editor email gb gloss head headItem headLabel hi index l label lb lg listBibl media meeting mentioned milestone monogr name num pb postBox postCode ptr pubPlace publisher q quote rb ref reg relatedItem resp respStmt rs rt ruby said series sic soCalled sp speaker stage street term time title unclear unit

moduleRef.include: catchwords collation condition depth dimensions foliation height locus material objectDesc origDate origPlace

elementSpec.desc: The location of a text or another feature within the manuscript. The "target" attribute is used for single folio. The "from" and "to" attributes are used together to describe a range of folios.
Describe how the correct ordering of the quires is ensured in the manuscript.
Describe the scope and composition of quires in prose inside the p element. For quiring formulas use the element of the same name and for the system for ordering quires use the catchwords element.

Describe the preservation, conservation and restoration history; present state of fragment; damages; record whether the manuscript has become less readable. Choose from the list supplied for the key attribute a generic description that fits best your overall impression.

valItem.desc: The item is badly preserved and severely damaged.
The item is preserved with minimal damages.
The item is preserved completely undamaged.
If you use this value, please provide in the description a proper motivation, otherwise avoid it.

elementSpec.desc: Describe how the folios or pages in the manuscript are numbered (Arabic numerals, Hebrew letters etc.), if there are multiple such devices and their range.
Describe the writing material. Choose from the list supplied for the "key" attribute what kind of material is used in the manuscript/this codicological unit.
Contains descriptions of the manuscript's physical components. Use the "form" attribute to indicate if the manuscript was created as a single unit, a composite, or a multiple text manuscript.
Fill in the date in the agreed-upon calendrical system. Use the "when" attribute for precise values. In case the date can only be approximated, use the "notAfter"and "notBefore" attributes together.

Look up the place records in the database to specify the location where the manuscript or manuscript part was produced. Try different spellings in different languages! If no suitable record exists, create a new one. (The "ref" attribute will be filled out automatically when you link a place record to this element.)
This element contains descriptions of the codicological and paleographic features of a manuscript.
Enter prose text to connect the fields dedicated to specific elements and form a coherent descriptive text.
The depth of the book block, measured in millimeters.
The height of the leaf, measured in millimeters.
The width of the leaf, measured in millimeters.
How many folios does the manuscript/this codicological unit contain?
This elements contains the measurements of the leaves.
This element contains descriptions of the writing material in various child elements.
This element contains descriptions of the writing material in various child elements.
Give the total number of folios for the call mark or msPart.
Describes the manuscript's quiring using some formalized system. (Differentiate between quaternions, quinions, etc. and provide the number and position of extant (bi)folios within the quire.)
